I don`t know what part is funnier whether its when Nielson is in Ricardo`s room playing with the rare pen and the fish or when he is at the press conference or when he is up on the siding of the building or could it be the beginning of the film or could it be the great baseball game? Like I said this movie is so funny.There are two sequels to the Naked Gun but to ME this is the best of the three. If you need a good laugh or cheer someone up this is the movie to watch!
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: "One Man's Trash is Another Man's Treasure!" Cancelled on TV, the "POLICE SQUAD!" Project taken to PARAMOUNT PICTURES and the "movies" , with great $ucce$$!!
Review_body: The creative team of Zucker/Abrahams/Zucker were "overnight" successes with the public acceptance and Box Office $ucce$$ of their AIRPLANE!(Paramount, 1980). This opened the door to them for other projects. So, to the small screen of Television Land they did travel.Utilizing the same type of "tongue in cheek", verbal punning and sight gag loaded spoofing humor as AIRPLANE, they chose to launch a double barreled assault on the Cop Show. The result was POLICE SQUAD!(1982).The series produced a grand total of six(6) measly episodes, but what a six episodes they were. Each was a little gem on its own, and would have worked well as those "old time" 2 Reelers Comedies once so popular at the theatre, featuring the likes of Laurel & Hardy, The Three Stooges, Edgar Kennedy, 'Joe McDoakes', Pete Smith, etc.Well, some joker with a position as an Executive at the American Broadcasting Company (ABC) TV Network pronounced the series as a candidate for the 'old Axe' because ".....you have to pay too much attention to the episodes on your TV.", or some such dribble.So away went "POLICE SQUAD" with Captain/Lieutennant/Sergeant Frank Drebbin(Leslie Nielsen), ne'er to be heard from again. WRONG! In 1988, the concept with Leslie Nielsen starring rose again as THE NAKED GUN: From The Files of Police Squad!( Paramount, 1988). It was a feature film, one that required viewing at a movie house and paying an admission. Well, with 2 sequels following, it's kinda obvious that it was successful, where it counts, with the public!* The story opens up with a scene of a big meeting of America's Enemies. Among those being portrayed are Castro, Khadaffi, Arafatt, Idi Amin, the Ayatola Khomani and others. Their meeting being broken up by the sudden appearance of Frank Drebbin, on special Government assignment.Back home in L.A., he is met at the Airport by his boss, Captain Ed Hocken(George Kennedy)who informs him of the coming visit of State by Her Majesty, Queen Elizabeth II to Los Angeles. A visit complicated by the Underground Operations by Some Murderous Gang of Drug Smugglers. The city Fathers are concerned over some Murders connected to them. Also, Detective Nordberg (O.J. Simpson) lies close to death in Hospital after attempting to infiltrate the Mob.The plot takes us on a merry chase, all 'round L.A., before winding up at the California Angels' "Big A" Ball Park in Aneheim.Without getting into particulars, let's just say that this is the Crown Jewels of the whole picture. We are treated to a succession of super gags, each as good or better than the last. The back-drop of a Baseball Game between the Angels and the Seattle Mariners provides the opportunity for Leslie Nielasen to perform a true Tour-de-Force of Comedic Performance that will remain unmatched for many a year! (Oh, Hell! Just see it, next chance you get!)
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: Leslie Nielsen, the king of travesty
Review_body: This morning I heard a really sad news, that Leslie Nielsen has passed away at the age of 84 to pneumonia.This man became known from a numerous spoof movies.He really was the master when it came to parodies.David Zucker's, Jim Abrahams' and Jerry Zucker's The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad! (1988) is one we all know.In it Leslie plays Detective Frank Drebin, the character we first saw in the short-lived Police Squad series (1982).Frank causes a lot of damage, but he also gets the criminals in the end.In the first movie Drebin tries to safe the Queen Elizabeth II from assassination.Frank's sweetheart is played by Priscilla Presley.George Kennedy is Ed Hocken.O.J. Simpson, when he was mainly known from football and acting, plays Nordberg.Ricardo Montalban is Vincent Ludwig.Jeannette Charles is the Queen.Ed Williams plays Ted Olsen.We also see 'Weird Al' Yankovic in the movie.And Dr. Joyce Brothers.The movie has lots of funny stuff that has made me laugh many times over the years.Take the baseball scene, for instance.So thanks for the laughs, Leslie!
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: First time I watched The Naked Gun it got me almost enlightened by laughing my best piece off (the only movie I remember where the laugh-o-meter did hit harder is The Life of Brian, of course, one could dare to say). The role of Lt. Frank Drebin was made for Leslie Nielsen like the almighty Conan for Mr. Schwarzenegger. On top, the whole cast is playing fine and obviously having fun and there are lots of funny and even original and remarkable ideas around. What else? Well, this is comedy (almost) in perfection.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: "The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad" has so many laugh-out-loud moments it's impossible to list them all. There are even more smiles. The cast is terrific. They all do a great job. They play the material perfectly. "Naked Gun" has very little, if any, downtime. The short running time (85 min) is perfect. I remember seeing this movie in the theater (Movieworld, Douglaston, NY). I liked it a lot back then and I still like it a lot now. "Naked Gun" is great fun.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: Great Laughs From A Great Movie
Review_body: This is a genuinely funny movie in the tradition of Airplane.Too many jokes to take in with a single viewing this movie will keep you laughing for a long time.The movie does have a plot but its not that important.A great cast, even OJ (which is really weird these days) support Nelson as he bungles his way from one successful disaster to another.Funny funny funny :)
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: Nielsen takes charge of another Zucker, Abrahams and Zucker gem
Review_body: What started in 1977 with "Kentucky Fried Movie" continues again in "The Naked Gun," a film version of the TV series "Police Squad!" only this time detective/cop films are the culprit, seemingly perfect fodder for spoofing and the Zucker, Abrahams and Zucker one-two punch of subtle literalist humor and preposterous gags. The only real difference between this and 1980's "Airplane!" is that Lesley Nielsen takes command of this film as opposed to an all-cast effort.Nobody must be able to keep a straighter face than Nielsen. As Lt. Frank Drebin, the things he must do and say while remaining ignorant to their comedic value are absurd in quantity and quality. Drebin is when James Bond meets Inspector Clouseau -- he's completely oblivious yet he knows exactly what he's doing. As contradictory as that sounds, it's completely true. Nielsen does both incredible deadpan and slapstick, a highly specialized skill for a comedian, and unfortunately for the rest Nielsen's career, that's all he has. Nevertheless, it's perfect for "The Naked Gun."Unlike "Airplane!", this film has to be a bit more plot-focused because the cop/detective genre necessitates it. "Airplane!" could descend into utter chaos, whereas "The Naked Gun" feels obligated to make sense in some regard. All you need to know is that O.J Simpson's character got shot and the investigation leads to the uncovering of a possible assassination attempt on the life of Queen Elizabeth II. The challenge for the viewer is to forget making sense of what's going on and pay attention to the small details that make these films even funnier. In some scenes this is easier than others and for the most part, the easier it is, the better "The Naked Gun" gets.A lot of the times these are the laughs that make you smile inside instead of laughing out loud, but especially toward the end when the humor becomes more slapstick, "The Naked Gun" really takes off ... pardon the "Airplane!" lingo. Another fun film from these guys.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: The Naked Gun is one of the Zucker Brothers' more entertaining films, and one of the better spoofs of crime/action films out there. Like their masterpiece "Airplane", this film includes Leslie Neilsen (as detective Frank Drebben) as well as an odd assortment of actors and celebrities from B-films and the sports world, this time including Priscilla Presley, George Kennedy, Ricardo Montalban, and O.J. Simpson among others. You could almost spend the whole film just watching for celebrity cameos (the best of which is Reggie Jackson as a brainwashed assassin: "must kill the queen.. must kill the queen." Some of the jokes don't work and quite a lot of them are just stupid puns, but the physical comedy is generally well done. Presley makes a surprisingly effective "straight man". The jokes keep rolling in fast enough that even the ones that miss don't slow down the fun.Just by coincidence I saw the movie recently after seeing the Zucker's "Kentucky Fried Movie" just a few days before. So I noticed that they actually re-used one device from that film here, the botched break-in (which occurs in KFM during the extended martial arts sequence) where Neilsen goes into Montalban's character's apartment and smashes just about everything in sight (eventually starting a fire) while supposedly trying to sneak around.Not a classic film in my opinion nor am I sure it ever will be, but it's well worth a few laughs if you're in the right mood.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: Yes this is the one that kicked off that trio of infectious comedy slapstick. I actually like The Naked Gun's better than the Flying High's, only this time the brilliant Nielsen is at the helm, where he belongs. Lets face it, any film, that starts in Beirut is interesting. The great criminal here is Fantasy Island's Montalban, who has diabolic plans, ones that include brainwashing, which will aid him in assassinating the queen, where the queen really looks like the queen in this one. His captain is played by George Kennedy and like Nielsen, with being all so serious, he's created a likable character, where O.J. Simpson (yes, that's the one) plays his partner, to adequate ability (his only acting nomination is a bad one) more of a player than actor, you could say. Like the Flying High's the laughs keep coming, but here, it's at a more accelerated rate. Montage's have never been funnier, than the one you'll see here, especially, if you take pokes at Stone's Platoon, though that's kind of in bad taste. Taking pokes at Rambo would of been funnier. And this is the one, where Nielsen his eyes on the luscious Presley (God, if Elvis could see her now). She's sexy and really impresses with her character, Simpson an almost useless asset in these ones. Of course, there are those stupid moments, but that's expected in in slapstick. The brainwashing bits here, were the ones that didn't wash off. This really came at a time, we needn't something like this. It's slapstick, but it's original, smart, and fresh and garners laughs at a rate, that may'be even too quick. Excellent 89' slapstick comedy, never forgotten, and never watched once. Spawned two equally funny sequels.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: This is one of my favorite comedies of all time as well as parodies in the Parody subgenre of comedy. It's also another one of the best TV to movie adaptations as this film is a continuation of the show "Police Squad" which was a hit at the time but unfortunately had a short life span almost about the same as the TV show "Firefly". I honestly feel this is something most TV show should do when they don't get to go the distance, jump on another track to get there which this film did.The film is sort of an adolescent gem of mine as in my adolescence I began to explore more of the parody genre. And as a kid I have seen the TV show "Police Squad" which was one of my favorite comedy shows.When I saw they made a silver screen film based on that show it really blew me away, though once I rented out and saw the film I was just blown away. It was a real gut buster, I just laugh so hard watching this film that it almost hurts, that's something I rarely do for most comedy films, let alone not that many that can do that with me but thankfully this film is one of them and still is.This film is really a smoothie drink of parody as it parodies on the detective/cop shows of yesteryear, noir but also the James Bond franchise. I know that last one seems like a stretch but not as the film has some of the elements and format you would see on a Bond movie, from the very beginning, a scene with Frank goes to the crime lab and is introduced to gadgets, as well as the whole assassination plot, you name it for any Bond fan it's all there.The film is fully loaded with visual and verbal humor and hits the target on both counts. There is just so much that even on rewatch I can always find some more that might have flew by me making the film funnier than before. The dialog in the film is just hilarious, the characters have some colorful even deliciously bad lines but also some clever lines that can really catch you off guard, but what makes the dialog funny is the fact that everyone is just downright serious as if what their saying and what is going on is more or less the everyday norm.There are so many memorable scenes of hilarity, I'll just say a few of my favorites as talking about them can't do the comedy justice and I don't want to give too much away.The beginning which is to me one of the best openings in movies in general, it's always a great way to start off a film with a bang. It's a bit similar to the beginning of a Bond movie where we see a meeting held by an organization of evil much like Spectre from James Bond with some of the scummiest people in history all in one table and all up to no good as usual. This is obviously a set up for the plot of the film. But of course, in the end it results in one of my favorite battles of all time as well as the most hilarious as Frank just beats the crap out of everyone in the room, which is something most of us think of doing to scumbags all in the same room.There is a chase scene which is just hilarious and slightly thrilling with Frank being in the one car in the chase which is the last one you'd want to be in which is a Driving School car which let's just say gave the trainee driver one hell of a crash course. But what really made it even more hilarious was a death scene that could make Michael Bay envious.The final half with the Baseball game is just absolutely hilarious as not just is Frank trying to stop an assassination but also, he's lets just say making Baseball history.I really like the music which is sort of an old jazzy score which fits the film giving it an old-fashioned noir vibe to it. I really love the theme song which is one of my favorite themes of all time, just really gives you that empowering theme that the good guys are on the way to help. But also, it's one of my favorite intros as we see only the top perspective on an old squad car with the siren going and that car just seems to have a mind of it's own as it is just driving in some of the most random places let alone fit somehow, one place I like is where it parks at a doughnut shop with a dozen priced 1.99; yeah that would be a dream come true.The supporting characters and cast are solid from George Kennedy as Ed the chief who is really a solid straight man that just really helps in setting Frank straight though in the world of parody even he himself has his quarks. Ricardo Montalban whom is an honorable mention in favorite actors of mine, he's just great in the villain role as usual because it's Ricardo after all where he is suave and charismatic but also has that quiet sinisterness that simmers before it boils to the surface.But of course, what makes the film is Leslie Nelson himself one of my favorite comedic actors; this guy is practically the king of parody comedy as there's never been another since. Really love his performance because he just plays it straight from beginning to end which makes him and the film all the funnier. I really love the Frank Drebin character who is another of my honorable mention in fictional heroes.Frank is pretty much an old-fashioned cop from yesteryear but transported to our modern decade. This guy is so serious and tough that it's strange. He's really not that good at his job as he can be clumsy sometimes, a little rock headed both things inadvertently in his defense. Not quite with the times as he has sort of that attitude of a person from a different time. All these things would make him inefficient but despite the inefficiency he's does get the job done all the same if not smoothly.What make him endearing is that he how determined he is in completing his mission and just his overall never-ending crusade in fighting crime. Despite how tough things get for him (some of that inadvertently caused by himself) he keeps with it all the same. He's always does what's right no matter what and however he can because there really is no other way or any time to find a better way because it doesn't always exist, he just simply acts which makes him all the more effective in saving the day. I like also that he's a person that has some little quirks and a warmth to him, which makes him a guy you would like to be friends with though you probably want to keep your valuables away from him.This is a comedy classic that's full loaded with hilarity.Rating: 4 stars.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: The comedy team of Zucker, Abrahams and Zucker.
Review_body: The Naked Gun: From the files of Police Squad! (1988) marks the return of Lt. Frank Drebin, a character he played on the short lived television series POLICE SQUAD! This time around, one of his colleagues Nordberg (O.J. Simpson) is hospitalized after a botched undercover operation. Lt. Frank Drebin and his partner (George Kennedy) have to pick up where Nordberg left off. This leads him to Vincent Ludwig (Ricardo Montelban). Whilst investigating him he comes across his personal assistant Jane (Priscella Pressley). Drebin's smitten by Jane. But as the movie progresses: Will Drebin find true love? Can he catch Ludwig in a criminal act? What will happen to Nordberg? Do I need to see this movie? All questions will be answered when you watch THE NAKED GUN: FROM THE FILES OF POLICE SQUAD!!!A funny movie that's followed by two less than spectacular sequels. This one is highly recommended!
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: (Flash Review)What can you say. It's The Naked Gun. One of the best slap stick movies of all time. Jokes ranging from deadpan to silly to physical. They all string together to form a cohesive story. A story where OJ Simpson is a key comedic character. Today = Yikes! Leslie Nielson nails his character, with his dry deadpan approach, of an incompetent detective who must solve a plot to assassinate the Queen of England. The unknown culprit has a trick up his sleeve by using a crafty plan by planning to use a regular person as the trigger person. There are so many obvious and subtle jokes you need to focus to catch them all. This is up there with Airplane, Top Secret and UHF as some of the best slap sticks from that era.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: "Nice Beaver". "Thanks I recently had it stuffed."
Review_body: After learning that his colleague officer Nordberg has been shot multiple times and placed in intensive care Detective Frank Drebin sets to work in finding out who was responsible for this shooting. Worse is to follow though when Drebin discovers that the man responsible for the shooting is also planning on assassinating Queen Elizabeth 2 and sets to work foiling the mad man's plans in his own unique way...Sometimes even when films are made a long time ago they can still produce the laughs and the original Naked Gun film is one such example; it arguably uses the easiest approach to gain laughs (slapsticks and pratfalls) much like we used to see in the Pink Panther films, but it is mostly used to very good effect here and I have to admit that even after all these years I still found the film very very funny.One thing that I think has always made this film work so well is Leslie Nielsen; his dead-pan comic style and complete lack of awareness of all of the chaos that he is causing along the way is actually one of the things that makes what you see so funny. There's a sort of endearing innocence to Drebin (whereby the good intention is always there, but his approach leaves a lot to be desired).The plot is vague and only basically outlined, but in all honesty who really watches spoof or parody films for the plots. If you're just looking for laughs then this film has them in abundance - I don't want to spoil it for those who haven't seen the film, but trust me there are plenty on offer.This is Leslie Nielsen's film all the way and he really steals the show here; the likes of George Kennedy, Priscilla Presley & Ricardo Montalban are good in support, but they don't hold a candle to Nielsen. OJ Simpson didn't have much screen time in this one which wasn't much of an issue for me as I always felt that acting was never really his forte.In these grim times - particularly in the UK where we're still in our 3rd COVID-19 lockdown :-( The Naked Gun is a nice piece of escapist fun that is still capable of bringing the laughs after all these years.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: One of the best spoofs ever made.
Review_body: Incompetent Cop Frank Drebin (The late Leslie Nielsen) from Police Squad. He is investigating the attempted murder of his partner Nordberg (The infamous O.J. Simpson). He finds himself in a conspiracy that the millionaire Vincent Ludwig (The late Ricardo Montalban) is planning to assassinated Queen Elizabeth the Second (Jeannette Charles).Directed by David Zucker (Scary Movie 3 and Scary Movie 4, Ruthless People, Top Secret!) made an enjoyable comedic spoof, based on the failed TV Show. Which the TV Show was created by David Zucker, Jim Abrahams and Jerry Zucker. The late Nielsen is terrific as a clueless police detective. Priscilla Presley is amusing as Drebin's love interest. Oscar-Winner:George Kennedy appears in a supporting role as Ed Hocken from the Police Squad.DVD has an good anamorphic Widescreen (1.78:1) transfer and an digitally remastered Dolby Digital 5.1 Surround Sound. DVD includes an entertaining commentary track by David Zucker, Producer:Robert K. Weiss (The Blues Brothers, Dragnet, Tommy Boy) and Host:Peter Tilden. DVD also includes the original theatrical trailer. "The Naked Gun:From the Files of Police Squad!" is one of the most memorable spoofs ever made and it was certainly one of the funniest comedies made in the 1980's. There is some familiar faces in bit parts. TV Version adds some additional footage. Don't miss this Leslie Nielsen classic, Mr. Nielsen we will miss you. Written by Jerry Zucker (First Knight, Ghost, Rat Race), Jim Abrahams (Hot Shots! and Hot Shots! Part Deux, Big Business, Jane Austin's Mafia!), David Zucker and Pat Proft (Bachelor Party, High School High, Police Academy). (****/*****).
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: Zucker, Abrahams and Zucker have produced another zany and outrageous comedy. This time we follow the misadventures of cop Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen), a character portrayed in the TV series "Police Squad". Hence the full title of the movie: "The Naked Gun - from the Files of Police Squad".This 'Z.A.Z.' film has its moments, but few are absolutely hilarious as were the many fine comedy moments in both "Top Secret" and "Flying High". Look out for the scene where Drebin searches his partner's jacket by mistake, the definite highlight. Worth a look anyway, "The Naked Gun" will almost certainly raise a chuckle or two.Sunday, November 17, 1991 - Video
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: This is by far the best Leslie Nielson comedy. Almost every joke worked, and even the ones that didn't were done as well as they could be.Leuitenant Frank Drebin has to stop the murder of Queen Elizibeth, while trying to also figure out who's behind the attack of his police friend Norwood (OJ Simpson). Yes, the movie has no real plot and it's a bunch of gags thrown together, and yes, it begins to run out of steam by the end, but this is just a hilarious movie. Leslie Nielson's serious manner is perfect for his ridiculous lines, and the constant sight gags are hilarious. Even Pricilla Presley managed to be amusing.Great job to the Zuckers for their wonderful creation.My rating: *** 1/2 out of ****. 83 mins. PG-13 for sexual humor.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: This is the first, and probably best installment of "The Naked Gun" trilogy, a MAD magazine parody of police shows and movies brought to life by the Zucker-Abrahams-Zucker ("Airplane!") team.  Not all of the jokes work, and at times the film feels pretty bloated with its own comic excess, but I can't fault them for trying.  There are many moments of pants-wetting laughter, from the amplified urinal scene to the hilarious "ledge" sequence, to Leslie Neilsen's incredible rendition of "The Star-Spangled Banner."6.5/10
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: No Hot Dogs Were Harmed During The Making Of This Film!
Review_body: While we can all agree that the folks behind films like this and 'Airplane' are generally comedy geniuses and that Leslie Nielson delivers the parts superbly, I think it might also be fair to say that a lot of it hasn't aged that brilliantly. The humour isn't quite as sophisticated as we expect it to be these days, at least not quite as clever. It's silly and slapstick, which many people can't appreciate.At the time it did it's job and it did it well and I remember it being funnier then. Don't get me wrong it still gets a good few twitters of laughter from me and I still enjoyed it, because it's not an offensive film in general and neither is it filled with Sex, Drugs, Violence, Etc, but I do wonder how many more points it would have scored back when I first watched it.Frank Drebin is back on patrol following his escapades in 'Police Squad'. What ensues is a mixture of 'James Bond' and 'Murder She Wrote'. Chaos goes everywhere with Frank and it's usually very funny, but does he solve the case in time to save the innocent? You'll have to watch it.I seem to recall that the second film in the franchise was the best overall and will look out for that one too.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: Not as hilarious as back-in-the-day, but still pretty darn funny
Review_body: Gut bustingly hilarious when it first came out, but now not quite as much. Leslie Nielsen is undeniably funny as police detective Frank Drebin, the incompetent but deadly serious hero of the film who must stop an assassination attempt on Queen Elizabeth, though the film's humor is really around the incidental moments occurring around the main story. Some of those moments still hold up and others do not. What was most surprising watching this film now is how leisurely paced it seems compared to contemporary rapid fire comedies. It was also very odd to see O.J. Simpson playing kind mild mannered police detective Nordberg. Overall, this is still a worthy comedy and certainly worth checking out.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad is an incredible spoof that skillfully and effectively plays with the conventions of crime thrillers, even if a couple of the jokes overstay there welcome. Leslie Nielsen gives an incredible lead performance and Priscilla Presley and O.J. Simpson are both great. It's extremely well paced and consistently hilarious throughout with almost no pause between jokes. David Zucker's direction is great and its well filmed.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: The kind of comedy that won't be possible today.
Review_body: You know, because of all the « sensitive » (it's an understatement) minorities. But it's just the way every good parody should be. No filter, no shame, just pure fun and self awareness. I'm still impressed Leslie Nielsen was in his 60s back then, what a comedy animal. Obviously, it's the best of the franchise, but you can still watch the sequels if you're a big fan of his. I'm glad movies like these exist, just to escape this withdrawn era of PCbsness we in live today.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: "The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!" tells the story of a very motivated, yet very chaotic inspector at the police forces, who is hired to take care of the Queen's safety during her visit in the United States while having to battle a gangster boss whose aim it is to turn innocent people into cold-blooded killers.The movie is in many parts a great parody of the countless police action movies that have been around and inspired similar modern approaches such as "Austin Powers" or "Johnny English". I have to admit that, though I'm normally not a big fan of slapstick, many of the gags are presented very clever and show a very decent humor instead of just going for the easy laughs. Nontheless the plot remains nonsense of course and thus you shouldn't expect a great movie in terms of tension or story. On the other hand, those parts are clearly not in the focus of this title and so I think we can all live with this fact.All in all this is a great parody that still convinces with clever humor even decades after its production. It is, however, not a great film in itself and so I'll give it a medium rating but still advise to give it a try.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: One of the great comedy classics of the '80s, there's nary a miss or pause from start to finish as Nielsen tries to foil plot to kill Queen of England.  Kennedy and Presley are great in supporting roles.  Concept started out as 6 equally funny TV episodes six years earlier.  Inspired two amusing if inferior sequels, as well as a number of really unfunny copycats.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: Leslie Nielsen was a comedy genius
Review_body: 'The Naked Gun' trilogy has to be one of the greatest comedy series of all-time and this first film is probably up there as one of my all-time favourite comedy movies. Clearly when they made this film they were building on the success of the hugely popular 'Airplane' films. The formula is exactly the same and Leslie Nielsen is hilarious once again, delivering another laugh-a-minute performance. Anybody who likes slapstick comedy will love this film.Silly spoof comedies seem to be more popular than ever now, but I can't think of any from the modern day that come close to 'The Naked Gun' and 'Airplane' films. Nielsen is the main reason these films were such a hit and I doubt we'll see many comedy actors as talented as him again. I can only echo what another user has written in their review: Leslie Nielsen was a comedy genius.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: If you grew up during the 80s & 90s like myself,, you couldn't avoid seeing this on cable. Lol!! Join Leslie Neilson as he clumsily hunts down crooks in this goofy comedy.Go watch it!
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: A funny spoof, with continuous slapstick
Review_body: The only spoof movie I saw starring Leslie Nielsen before this one was "Spy Hard", and like so many others, I did not care much for it. However, knowing that "The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!" was a lot more popular (as I'm sure you can tell by comparing the IMDb ratings), I watched it with relatively high expectations. I found virtually no laughs in "Spy Hard", but found many in this police spoof, which proves that the mediocrity of SH has nothing to do with Nielsen's starring role.Detective Nordberg, a member of Police Squad, is shot multiple times during an investigation, and is nearly killed! While he is in the hospital, a fellow member of Police Squad, the clumsy Lieutenant Frank Drebin, must investigate this attempted murder. While on the case, Drebin eventually finds proof that Vincent Ludwig, a local businessman, plans to have the Queen of England assassinated during her visit in L.A.! Unfortunately, Drebin accidentally burns the proof of this assassination plot (he ends up burning a lot more than that), and Ludwig is a very well-respected individual, so how will the clumsy detective convince anyone of this sinister plan?!A ton of slapstick is featured in this spoof, and as big a fan as I am of the type of humour, I have to admit that this film may overdo it a bit at times, making some of the gags a tad too predictable. Fortunately, most of the movie doesn't have this problem. In fact, the jokes are often hilarious, whether they are physical gags, or comical lines! For better or worse, there are also some tasteless gags here and there, such as in the scene early in the film where Lieutenant Frank Drebin visits Detective Nordberg in the hospital. If you're into silly spoof movies and slapstick, and are generally not irked by raunchiness and/or tastelessness, I highly recommend "The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!" for you!
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: The movie itself is funny.  "The Naked Gun" is without a doubt the best skewering of all cop movie cliches available in this day and age.  It works on every conceivable level and a few that haven't been conceived yet.But what puts it over the top is Leslie Nielsen.It's amazing: he was great in "Airplane!", another classic from the ZAZ team (Zucker, Abrahams, Zucker), and in the lamentably short TV series "Police Squad!".  But here, he spreads his wings and flies to new heights of insanity and delerium.  With jaw set square and tongue firmly in cheek, Neilsen makes the role of Lt. Frank Drebin all his own and the movie-going public's collective life is all the more enriched because of it.He's aided and abetted by greats like Kennedy, Presley and Montalban (who knew?) and the movie even finds good moments for John Houseman and Reggie Jackson.  As I said, the movie takes off and finds great things to do with police cars with a mind all their own and goes on from there to take on such cliches as car chases, illegal searches, the cleaning out of the desk, the trip to the police lab, shoot-outs, the lax housework of a single police detective, etc., etc., etc.....And what other cop movie in the history of the world has a music video in the middle, courtesy of Herman's Hermits?Just one.Ten stars and a Dugout Dog for "The Naked Gun", the film that answers once and for all - can Leslie Nielsen do comedy?I think you know the answer.

Review title: Funny stuff from the late Leslie Nielsen...
Review_body: If actor Leslie Nielsen hadn't sadly died on November 28th this year (2010), I maybe wouldn't have watched this. I have seen it many times before but this is the first time I've attempted a review. The trouble with reviewing the work of someone that has recently passed is that you feel you don't want to say anything bad about them. I will, however, try to keep my impartiality. Here's a short summary of the plot before I get into it (summary haters please keep an eye on that crazy baseball umpire while I write the next paragraph).Undercover policeman, Nordberg, has been shot and it's up to inept cop Frank Drebin to find who's responsible. Add to that the fact that Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II is visiting the city and Drebin has his plate full. The finger of suspicion falls on respected businessman Vincent Ludwig and Frank decides to pay him a visit. There he meets Jane Spencer who has been persuaded by Ludwig to get close to Drebin so he can discover what the police know. During his investigation Drebin discovers a plot to assassinate the Queen during her visit. Can Frank find out who shot Nordberg and also stop the assassination attempt on the Queen and maybe even get the girl? So many questions, so little time.A pretty well made film with a very high gag (in the comedy sense) ratio. For me there were surprisingly few 'laugh out loud' moments though. I put it down to the difference in culture between the USA and the UK. We may speak more or less the same language, but what makes us laugh is very different. That isn't to say there were any bad performances, far from it, Leslie Nielsen was excellent as Frank Drebin, Priscilla Presley put in a stellar performance as Jane Spencer and Ricardo Montalban was excellent as Vincent Ludwig. Honourable mentions must also go to George Kennedy as Ed Hocken, O.J. Simpson as Nordberg and Nancy Marchand as the Mayor.I used to love the TV show but I'm afraid it doesn't translate too well to the big screen. It's still pretty good, but I don't think the humour comes across as well when you are bombarded with it for 80 minutes solid. So, over all, not as good as the TV show, but still recommended if only for Leslie Nielson's performance, he will be missed.My score: 7.6/10
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad! is classic slapstick comedy. It had a great story and right on dialogue that was perfectly said by the great actor Leslie Neilsen (who was the right pick for the role of Lt. Frank Drebin as well as the costars). Gags just keep happening at the right time, nicely paced throughout the film. The best scene in the film is when Frank Drebin accidentally tops a surprised Queen Elizabeth! And Ira Newborn's great score for this film and the successive two films is inventive, adding to the laugh out riot tone. A near perfect film that is a must see for anyone who is into comedy . . . a solid 9 out of 10.

Review_body: Leslie Nielsen's first movie as the pathetic Frank Drebin is without doubt the finest too. And it's a classic silly-comedy, featuring dozens of silly scenes leaving no space for it to be mistaken as a serious movie.The movie makes you laugh, that's for sure, because either you will find it so silly that you have to laugh at it, or you find it amusing, and you have to laugh with it. Review_body: The kind of film that proves that a small story can be much more meaningful than a larger one. Here's a rerun of many of the gags from the TV series Police Squad. It's an important film, as well as very entertaining. It is very light-hearted and it isn't complex at all. Visual gags come fast, and it's impossible to catch them all! From an artistic standpoint, there were some plot elements and character developments I didn't think were totally needed. They do however drive the story, which seemed to be their purpose, so I can accept them. Heartfelt and riveting from the first frame to the last. Great performances help to enhance this amazing story.

Review title: ... having your nuts bit of by a Laplander... That's the way I want it...
Review_body: "Naked Gun" is one of the few screw ball comedies that crack me up every time. There's something in it, that just wont age willingly, it stays fresh. Or maybe it's just my sense of humor, or the the fabulous acting of Leslie Nielsen, I laugh every time when I watch it.Leslie Nielsen plays Drebin, a detective, who spills out hard boiled inner dialogue and keeps his stone cut expression no matter what. He fights crime to the last. And with Drebin the crime wont last: it churns up into a chaos. Priscilla Presly is Jane Specner, a secretary of Vincent Ludwig (Ricardo Montalban) the bad guy of the film. Jane also is the la fem fetal whom Drebin falls head over heels. There is a plot about assassination of Queen Elizabeht II, but as this type of comedy works, the over all plot is pretty meaningless. And that's okay, at least for me: It's the humor that counts in this type of movies.David Zukcer has managed to milk everything from the movie, it is as funny as it could be. I can't see any way to improved the film, it has gags for everyone, be them fast sight gags or verbal juggling, or even slap stick comedy. Review_body: From the goofs that created Airplane! and Rat Race (David Zucker, Jim Abrahams, Jerry Zucker), here comes The Naked Gun, based on their short-lived TV series (Police Squad!).Leslie Nielsen is dunderheaded Lieutenant Frank Drebin, who is part of L.A.'s Police Squad. He's been their for awhile, but isn't the sanest person in the sanitarium. When the Police Squad is called on to protect the Queen of England on her visit to America, Frank is the main man. Along the way, he meets someone who may be in a plot to assassinate her.This may look like a plotless comedy, and it somewhat is. Just like Airplane!, it manages to have lots of sketches while still in the plot (unlike Austin Powers, for instance). Like the scene in Ludwig's office when Frank, let's say, changes it's decor. Nielsen is like his other films-the type of character who doesn't think he's funny but he is. Some jokes are tasteless (like the statues), but some are full of taste. Well, now that I think about it, there weren't many tastefull jokes, but The Naked Gun still made me laugh.There weren't as many funny parts as Airplane! (which was one huge laugh), but some scenes were side-splitting. The ending momentum slowed down some at the baseball game finale, and his checking the players got old after awhile. It was just in to stretch the running time to 85 minutes (which was a perfect length, by the way). Besides what I did, there's not much more to say about it except it's really funny and recommended.My rating: 8/10Rated PG-13 for sex-related humor.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: The stage curtains open ...When I saw this on the silver screen in late 1988, I had never heard of Police Squad, and in fact, I had never even knew about this movie. The girl I was dating at the time chose it, and so we went. I never laughed so hard. The poster alone will let you know exactly what you are in for, and this first movie of the Naked Gun Series doesn't disappoint.Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen) of Police Squad as been called in to investigate an attempt on his partner's life, and what he stumbles into is a conspiracy to assassinate Queen Elizabeth, who is touring America. Frank teams up with the secretary of his chief suspect, and what follows is a series of hijinks and mishaps that had most of us rolling in the aisles with laughter. Frank gets into hot water with the mayor, so he must beat the clock to foil the assassination attempt, win the girl, and secure his place back on the police force.I think part of what made this movie such a hit with me was that I went in blind, not really knowing what I was in for. There was no built up anticipation or hopes, just a young couple going to watch a funny movie. It is your classic inept detective comedy in the vein of other classics such as the Pink Panther and the Police Academy movies, and others that would follow like "Who's Harry Crumb?" and "The Other Guys". The blue print works as long as the movie and the acting is done well, and "The Naked Gun" certainly did that.I highly recommend this film to any comedy enthusiast. If you haven't seen this one yet, I know you would enjoy it. The cast does feature O.J. Simpson before his trial, but if that doesn't bother you, then you should give it a go. This is a classic now, and all these years later, I will still watch it from time to time and laugh just as much as the first time I saw it. 8 stars out of 10.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad! (1998, Dir. David Zucker) When Det. Nordberg (Simpson) is shot and placed into a coma, bumbling Lt. It leads him into the presence of rich Vincent Ludwig (Montalban) and a plot to assassinate Queen Elizabeth II (Charles).Hilarious spoof which doesn't slow down from start to finish. This was released back when spoof movies actually had a story. Instead of random gags, the jokes are tired together with a well thought of storyline, which shows perfectly why Leslie Nielsen will forever be known as the king of spoof.Frank, they're not here for you. "Weird Al" Yankovic is on the plane.  Captain Ed Hocken (George Kennedy)

Review_body: "The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!" is the first movie based on the 1982 cult classic TV sitcom "Police Squad!" And this movie stands up next to "Airplane!" as one of the funniest movies ever made. That's no surprise, since the same team (Zucker/Abrahams/Zucker) that made "Airplane!" made "The Naked Gun". This movie is quite similar to "Airplane!" in the way it presents its jokes. Rapid fire, and you can't stop laughing. My kind of comedy. "The Naked Gun" has some of the biggest laughs in a movie that I've ever seen. Leslie Nielsen is perfect in his return to the role of inept cop Lt. Frank Drebin. Priscilla Presley is very funny in her film debut. George Kennedy, Ricardo Montalban, and even Nancy Marchand (a decade before "The Sopranos") get big laughs amongst the craziness. And love that opening title sequence. Very original. And unlike the "Police Academy" series, "The Naked Gun" sequels lived up to the original 1988 film. The first one is still the best, but "Naked Gun 2 1/2" and "Naked Gun 33 1/3" were very funny too. That's why "The Naked Gun" series is the funniest movie series ever made. I wish Zucker/Abrahams/Zucker would dream up an idea for a fourth "Naked Gun" picture. If they do, I'll see it in a flash.**** (out of four)
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: Before the '90s had The Dude from "The Big Lebowski," and before "Borat" used the 2000s to roll around naked on a bed with his corpulent best pal, there was "The Naked Gun" and the legendary Frank Drebin, played with the straightest straight-face ever by the remarkable Leslie Nielsen. "The Naked Gun" comes from the ancestory.com chart first hinted at by "The Kentucky Fried Movie (1977),"most readily identified by the mighty "Airplane! (1980)," and most recently carried forth by raunchy music industry satire "Stadium Anthems (2018)."Gags in "The Naked Gun" rain down at a torrid pace; some deceptively high-brown, but most gloriously inane. It takes absolute geniuses to create such highly elevated stupidity.Is "The Naked Gun" somehow even better than its "Airplane!" forefather? By a nose, the vote here is "yes." While "Airplane!" also features Nielsen as a doctor (arguably even more straight-faced than Frank Drebin), that film's central character was the adequate Robert Hays, whereas "The Naked Gun" gives us Nielsen as the prime purveyor of every last morsel of hilarity. This is simply one of the greatest and most influential comedy films ever made. - (Was this review of any use to you? If so, let me know by clicking "Helpful." Cheers!)

Review_body: The Naked Gun is a spoof of most cop movies from any decade. In it, a bumbling detective uncovers a plot made by a big business man to murder the Queen of England at the World Series with a device that can control people's minds. It is a completely absurd comedy the likes of Airplane!, and anybody with a taste for hilarious parody will enjoy it.The plot of the movie is pretty good. It is mainly a spoof of detective movies from the 50s, what with the confident detective who narrates and speaks in the macho tone. Unfortunately, this detective is so clueless that everything he does is a major screw up. The humour in this movie isn't really intelligent humour. It's stupid humour that is so ridiculous it's funny. I can't really think of much else to say besides this movie is hilarious. It features one of my favourite kinds of humour, and that's word gags. Most of the jokes come from the way people speak to each other rather than visually.Leslie Nielsen is a great comedian, and this movie is no exception. The other actors in the film are good as well, including Percilla Presley and Ricardo Montalbon.Overall, this is a classic comedy I would recommend to anybody who needs a good laugh.8/10

Review_body: The second DVD up for viewing from our weekly grab was "The Naked Gun". I hadn't seen for a long time and figured I'd probably get more jokes in it than I did when I was 12.The story, if you haven't seen it for some reason, revolves around Frank Drebin (Nielsen), a wacky cop who is given the responsibility of overseeing the security for the impending visit of the Queen. Also on his plate is discovering what happened to his closest friend Nordberg(O.J Simpson, before he did you know what), who was shot at repeatedly on a drugs investigation. Drebin soon discovers there's a link between the visit and the attempt on Nordberg's life and sets about catching a would be assassin before they get to the Queen.From the same writers of the original "Flying High", there is some comedy gold in here. While some of it has aged, there's plenty of good stuff in there still. Besides discovering some innuendo I was oblivious to as a pre-teen, I found a few new jokes plus spotted the guy who played Elaine's dad in "Seinfeld" as a the Angels manager.One of the great comedies of the 80's.

Review title: Innovative comedy spoofing inept high profile police work
Review_body: This is a rather refreshing 'new kind of comedy', with an original premise: Have a law-man who is clearly 'not with it' go on a crime-fighting spree, critically injuring innocent people as he goes, only to end up catching the bad guys (by accident or by mistake), receiving top recognition for his fine work. You must see this sort of bizarre non-sense to believe it! When Police Sergeant Frank Drebin (played by Leslie Nielsen) first appeared on American TV screens back in about 1980, we weren't quite ready for the humor that came "without a cuing laugh track". A few years later "The Naked Gun" gave us another chance. This time it "took"! The one-liners and come backs in this film are hilarious, as the clumsy Drebin "always gets his man". Pricilla Presley is wonderful as the "agent for the enemy" who soon becomes Drebin's love interest.The scenes where fellow police officer Nuremberg (played by O.J. Simpson) repeatedly gets brutally injured (to roaring laughter from the audience) have been criticized as racist. Some of the "double entendre" is a bit risqué for kids, but otherwise this is fun for any age audience.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: Leslie Nielsen at his very best
Review_body: There are few directors who can make a screwball comedy better than brothers David and Jerry Zucker. And there are few actors better at playing dumb, or at remaining straight faced in the midst of travesty than the late, great Leslie Neilson. When you put them together, the results are nothing less than spectacular. Case in Point, The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!, which is one of the most outrageous, side splittingly hilarious comedies ever made.Neilson is perfectly cast as LAPD Lieutenant Frank Drebin, who surely must be related to the legendary inspector Clouseau. After socking it to America's enemies in the utterly ridiculous pre-title sequence, Drebin must save Queen Elizabeth II from an assassination plot at the hands of the dastardly Vincent Ludwig (Ricardo Montalbon). This would prove impossible for the spectacularly incompetent detective if not for one small fact: everyone else in this movie is nearly as clueless as he is. Rarely does a movie combine as many comedic devices, or use them to such effect, as this film. Naked Gun joins together the slapstick of Keaton, the manic energy and one-liners of the Marx Brothers, and the sheer ridiculousness of Monty Python, then dials them up in a way that only the Zuckers can manage. The slapstick sequences build and build, linking together one mishap after another in a way that defies all logic. Their dialog utilizes a one of a kind mixture of double entendre, mixed metaphors, monologues, and self-negating sentences that produce some of the most quotable lines in cinema. Speaking of quotes, watch for delicious parodies of some of the best known lines from famous cop dramas.And before the movie ends, they manage to skewer practically every cliché known to the cop genre. The shootouts, the chases, the interrogations, the tearful meeting with the partner's wife, it's all here. They even managed to spoof the opening credits of practically every cop movie ever made. And no-one understands the comedic power of overstatement more than they do. Their car chases don't end in a massive fireball, they end in three. When they introduce the requisite romantic subplot, they take you through every possible variation of the semi-obligatory lyrical interlude. And when the hero's heartfelt statement of true love comes, it's so moving that it ends the Arab/ Israeli feud. While they were at it, the Zuckers also managed to spoof the Bond franchise, and to include possibly the best sports scene in any non-sports movie. It may not be subtle, or entirely tasteful, or contain any twists that a third grader couldn't predict, but Naked Gun is just about the most fun you can have at the movies. There is not a single moment that passes without a gag, and you'll be laughing so hard you'll hardly have time to breath.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: Hilarious film that's more clever than some people realize
Review_body: It's difficult to review a comedy, which is why I haven't attempted it until now. (What do you say, after all? "This is a really, really funny movie!") The great thing about "The Naked Gun" is that, in addition to being genuinely funny, it's a smart little film. Perfect example: Raymond Chandler fans will get a kick out of the reference to "Farewell, My Lovely". Upon his first meeting with Priscilla Presley's character, Leslie Nielsen (as Lt. Frank Drebin) notes in the voice-over, "She was giving me a look I could feel in my hip pocket." This line is lifted directly from Chandler's novel, but it's so subtle and fits into the film so well that viewers who know nothing of Chandler won't feel left out. This, along with Nielsen's lovably goofy performance, is what separates the work of the Zucker brothers from knockoffs like "Loaded Weapon". Sure, you've seen "The Naked Gun" already...but see it again and you'll pick up on things you didn't notice the first time. (Single best moment of the film: O.J. Simpson's absurdly prolonged reaction to being shot by Ricardo Montalban's goons. It sends me into fits of laughter every time!)
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: Featuring OJ Simpson In His First Dramatic Role
Review_body: There are movies that are a series of sketches put together on the strength of a simple plot. The Naked Gun is one of those movies. The plot? Terrorists want to assassinate the Queen of England while she's visiting Los Angeles. The sketches? They all work. Ingredients for a wonderful movie, all met by the zany Zucker brothers, who also produced the Airplane! movies in the early 1980s. Based on the cult TV show Police Squad!, in which only 6 episodes were made, The Naked Gun follows Officer Frank Drebin (Leslie Neilson) around LA while he does what he does. What he actually does is difficult to explain, but he does it all well enough to be the hero by the end of the movie. Among the sketches in the movie is perhaps my favorite series of events, when the Queen visits a baseball game. Why the Queen of England visits Dodger Stadium to watch the big Seattle Mariners-California Angels game, that's anyone's guess. But between the 7 announcers at the beginning of the game, to Enrico Palazzo singing the national anthem to the umpire frisking all of the players during the game, it is my favorite 20 minute stretch of any movie. Hilarious! The rest of the movie is filled with wonderful moments of comedy, never taking itself too seriously. The film also boasts OJ Simpson in his first dramatic role, and he does well playing a beat up, almost dead guy. He played the part well, wonder what ever happened to that up-and-coming actor?
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: The Police Squad series seemed like a very promising sitcom in conception. It is very unfortunate that it did not go beyond six episodes. At least it was revived as a feature film.Compared to AIRPLANE and TOP SECRET, this Zucker/Abrams collaboration has more nuanced zaniness. The sight gags, while still outrageous, seem very natural and subtle. They're not as in your face as the ones in AIRPLANE. The film carries the tone of a typical police drama of the day; so there is still room for romance and sentimentality while not straying far from the comedy.This makes it the best Zucker/Abrams comedy. I wonder what their comic influences were.This has always been nostalgia for me.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: Warning: this movie WILL make your sides hurt
Review_body: Well, it sure made my sides hurt, and my friends', and my familys', and my classmates', and every stranger, co worker I've ever talked too, etc. This, "Top secret", and "Airplane" are the funniest spoofs ever. I don't even know where to start. If I was to list every funny thing from this film here, I would be writing a review 10 pages long. I'd be writing a book! And almost everyone on earth who hasn't been on Mars since 1989 most likely has almost every joke in this movie memorized by now. Just about everybody who will read this review will already know every joke. But I'll still name three out of my fifty favorite jokes here. One: Leslie starting to make a speech and the way he started his speech when everyone was actually there to see Weird Al Yankavits. Two: Leslie forgetting to take off his microphone at city hall when going to the mens room. Three: the whole scene at Ludwig's apartment from accidentally setting it on fire straight through to the concrete statues joke. Also, Ludwig was played by Riccardo Montablan for those who've recognized him from the love interest in a couple of Esther Williams' films. The Marx brothers were the best and funniest films of Hollywood's golden age. And Naked gun, Top secret, and Airplane are the best, funniest movies from the more modern times. Rest in peace Leslie Nielson. You HAVE made difference.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: The Naked Gun: From The Files of Police Squad! (1988) D: David Zucker. Leslie Nielsen, Priscilla Presley, Ricardo Montalban, George Kennedy, OJ Simpson, Susan Beaubian, Nancy Marchand. The incompetent cop from the POLICE SQUAD TV series (Nielsen) sets out to foil a plot to assassinate Queen Elizabeth. The ultimate spoof film, with a gag literally every five seconds. Review title: It was easy my dear. You forget I spent two years as a building contractor.
Review_body: Frank Drebin is a cop on the trail of the world's worst terrorists and after a major successful operation returns to the United States, only to be upstaged by Weird Al Yankovic! This is the madcap world that Frank Drebin inhabits, a world where scientists find the ultimate deterrent for Graffiti artists, where a cop can fall into a birthday cake and a mantrap and both can be as bad as the other and a place where you take a risk when you cross a street or stick your face in a fan.However, when it comes to danger it's nothing compared to the attempted assassination of Queen Elizabeth during her forthcoming state visit. As Drebin's investigations continue he begins to suspect that respected industrialist Vincent Ludwig is connected to the plot and, against his superior's wishes he undertakes a lone crusade in order to prove his point.This is the best of the naked gun films and Leslie Neilsen's delivery is free from the over the top looks that so mark out his later turns in the role of Drebin, and the script unlike, the second film contains fewer references from the Police Squad series, with many good gags and memorable moments. As such this makes for an entertaining slice of hokum that leaves one with a smile of your face when you stop watching it.While it's not as good as the immense "Airplane" it is still worthy of a watch and very entertaining.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: So I decided to check something on the "Naked Gun" page. And then there it was. This strange force. Drawing me towards the link that allowed me to add my own comment. I tried to resist. But this force was drawing me forward. I felt myself being sucked in. Finally, I surrendered in reckless abandonment and decided, oh, fine, I'd write a superfluous comment that, once again, recommends this movie, even though I had nothing new to say about it. As if I had some kind of obligation to comment about movies I liked a lot. If I don't have anything new to say, then I have no obligation! Or do I? Anyway, this movie is very very funny and highly recommended. (shudder)

Review_body: Leslie Nielsen heads a talented cast in the first "Naked Gun" film. He stars as Lt. Frank Drebin, and his bumbling pursuit of a criminal mastermind serves as the main plot in "The Naked Gun". Along the way he must also act as security for the Queen of England who is making a visit, which allows for more hilarious antics from one of the most funny actors in Hollywood.Nielsen is supported by a great cast including Priscilla Presley as his love interest Jane Spencer (the scene where they have "safe sex" is perhaps one of the funniest scenes I have ever seen in a movie), Ricardo Montalban as the villainous Vincent Ludwig, George Kennedy as Drebin's kind-hearted superior Captain Ed Hocken, and Nancy Marchand who is terrific as the dismissive Mayor Barkley."The Naked Gun" is not just a straight-comedy, there are literally countless spoofs littered throughout the film, as well as plenty of remarks on society. Aside from the "safe sex" scene other highly amusing scenes include Drebin and a learner driver, O.J. Simpsons blundered attack on some crooks, and Drebin destroying a valuable collection of artwork and statues.The main problem with the film though is that it seems to have aged. Several of the social context related jokes and themes seem lost in today's society, but were no doubt effective in their time. Being only 4 years old when the film was originally released it is a bit hard to remember though. Overall, an entertaining and enjoyable film.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: This is exactly how to do a parody! Over the years, there have been many imitations, but few can match the sharp wit and pitch-perfect delivery of David Zucker and the rest of the team of writers (Jim Abrahams, Jerry Zucker and Pat Proft). The film is filled with hilarious gags that aspiring comedy writers and directors can learn from. This is not a hit-or-miss comedy. Either the jokes are funny or hilarious. There are very few bad apples in this bunch. First of all, the casting of Leslie Nielsen was genius. It's a shame that we don't see much of him anymore. His timing and delivery are impeccable. Nielsen started out as a serious actor, which I think makes his performance even funnier. If Zucker were to cast a Jim Carrey type in the role, he would try too hard to milk out the comedy in each scene. What makes Nielsen so funny is that he doesn't seem like he's trying to be funny, and as I say time and time again that's how you're supposed to do comedy! It must be done with a straight face! My favorite gag is the one in which Nielsen hangs off the ledge of a building and grabs onto a statue's penis to stop himself from falling down. That scene had me laughing so hard that I was running out of breath! I literally laughed for about 5 minutes straight! Yes, it's that funny! I like the sequels, but the original "Naked Gun" is the best of the bunch. A must-see for comedy fans!
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: The Naked Gun came out when I was only eight years old, and way too young to appreciate a lot of its jokes.  Still, there was enough low-brow and physical comedy to crack me up, and it was one of my early favorite movies. And while I've outgrown a lot of stuff I liked at that age, I can still watch The Naked Gun and laugh, and I even get the jokes that went way over my head as a young'un.The film, subtitled From The Files of Police Squad!, couldn't be simpler, and that's the way they want it.  Lt. Frank Drebin has to to clear the name of his partner Norberg (The now ironic OJ Simpson) while protecting the life of Queen Elisabeth, in Los Angeles on a tour of America.  For ninety minutes, the movie exploits, and frequently ignores, the plot in the name of jokes.  Just plain and simple, this movie is out to make you laugh, and it will sink to any depth to get there.  Everyone has their favorite Naked Gun moment; mine has to be Leslie Nielsen performing the worst rendition of the Star Spangled Banner in history.  His fireside monologue about a lost love who played the harp is priceless as well.Kudos also to Ricardo Montalban's  performance as real estate tycoon Vincent Ludwig.  So ridiculous is his accent and accentuations that he makes even straight lines funny.  I'll never get tired of him saying to a frightened Priscilla Presley, "It was easy my dear!  You forget I spent two years as a building contractor!"  Stupidty at its funniest.This is not a classic, and it didn't change the face of comedy (It is after all, a simple application of the "Airplane!" formula to cop movies), but The Naked Gun is funny, and it never loses its charm no matter how many times you watch it.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: Leslie Nielson stars in The Naked Gun as Frank Drebin of Police Squad. This film is the jewel atop the crown of comedy, this film beats everything into the dust. Forget Airplane, Hot Shots, Scary Movie, this film is the spoof king! First there is the great cast with Leslie Nielson playing the dumb but straight role,George Kennedy provides good laughs as Franks buddy Ed, and I must say I enjoyed O.J Simpson as Nordberg. Then there's the phenomenal script, which starts out with Drebin kicking the crap out of terrorist to Nordberg being shot, burned, caked, toasted, bitten, and stabbed on a ship, but the big plot fills in with the attempt of assassinating the Queen of England (Reggie Jackson makes a cameo here)But the dumb jokes and one liners is the icing on this cake. Examples: "Everything will be alright Mrs. Nordberg, your husband will be fine." "Unless he turns into a mindless vegetable." Drebin being hit with a pillow and he screams as though it's alive. "Don't worry Mrs. Nordberg, nothing will stop me from solving this crime. There is no time to waste! Now lets go get a bite to eat." The whole student driver sequence, the love video with Frank and his girlfriend, and the villain giving a demonstration with the Queens death with his secretary. Examples over. Best movie I've seen in a long time. After reading this, get up, go out, and get a copy of The Naked Gun! Perfect, 10 out of 10. Enjoy!
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review title: An Absolute Success from the ZAZ comedy team.
Review_body: The writing team of David Zucker, Jim Abrahams and Jerry Zucker became a famous success after "Airplane!" made nearly 24 times its budget. Although "Kentucky Fried Movie" exceeded its own 33 times, it was their second film that gripped the attention of the critics and the public alike. They parlayed its success into the six episode show "Police Squad." After "Top Secret!," they went back to their short-lived television show and made the first of three "Naked Gun" films. Bringing back the show's star Leslie Nielsen and their signature machine gun paced humor, they crafted their finest work.Why did I spend 100 words, giving the background to this movie? The answer is that there is not much else to say without spoiling the hilarious content. I grew up on Abbott and Costello, Laurel and Hardy, and the Three Stooges; the first two are legendary and the third has a fiercely loyal following to this day. It has been difficult ever since for a comedy to impress me. There are only two comedies I have given a vote of ten stars. "The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!" is even better than "Spaceballs."Inept Lt. Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen) of Police Squad returns from abroad to the news that his partner (O.J. Simpson, when he was still funny) has been shot. We see it happen in the first of many sequences where we think the joke is over and then see it go on and on using wildly out-of-place props. Meanwhile, Vincent Ludwig (Ricardo Montalban), one of the most respected citizens in Los Angeles, has concocted an elaborate scheme to assassinate the visiting Queen of England! Thankfully, Lt. Drebin's boss (Oscar winner George Kennedy) and the rest of Police Squad have been assigned to protect her. That means Drebin must cross horns with Ludwig to prevent international disaster from culminatingat a Major League Baseball game! I am a *huge* baseball fan, and the climax is the most sensationally funny scene I have ever watched. I even saw my hometown team, although Zucker, Abrahams and Zucker clearly had no idea how bad the Seattle Mariners were at the time. They do prove that you don't have to know baseball to make it into the Television Booth.From an acting standpoint, "The Naked Gun" is about as good as it gets. Comedy is an entirely different discipline than dramatic acting. That is why you hear about certain actors simply as "comedians." Some critics and acting teachers believe comedy is harder. Nielsen is the king of treating outrageous scripts like they are "The Ten Commandments." He has been in many bad comedies, but with the right script, few are better at making even the best jokes funnier than they already are.Also notable is Ricardo Montalban. He publicly mentioned that he took the part for money to buy a new Chrysler. I immediately thought of Sean Connery upon reading this. After "Thunderball," Connery grew uninterested in playing James Bond, possibly from the strain of four films in four years plus the deplorable Japanese media's behavior during the shooting of "You Only Live Twice." In both that film and the later "Diamonds Are Forever," a role he only took for the cash, his boredom is unmasked in the two worst lead performances of the series.Such is not the case with Montalban. His facial expressions during the seventh inning stretch of the baseball game and his conversation with a terrorist whose name I would never wish on anybody look like they come from a man enjoying the part. The ability to keep external factors off the screen or stage is one of the fundamental cores of acting that has been lost on many talented thespians through the years. Montalban is not one of them. Other actors should take notice.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: In order to properly criticize David Zucker's "The Naked Gun" you must first understand that picking on the hastily written superficial plot would be missing the point. The plot can be whatever it wants to be. This movie is about sticking as many slapstick set-pieces as humanly possible in every single frame and every single moment. It's live-action Looney Tunes.But still, what is it about? Well, it's about the incompetent and delusional police Detective Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen) who must foil an attempt to assassinate Queen Elizabeth II. Take a time to absorb the last half of that sentence and get used to it. Sudden escalations are this movie's bread and butter. They also add up to making this one of the funniest movies ever made. And it should be, considering how much it defies any notion of continuity or just plain sense! The humor is everywhere--both up front and center represented by Debrin's cartoon-level ridiculous misadventures and in the background hidden as easy to miss Easter eggs. I am sure that on my only viewing of this I've missed some things.Timing is everything when it comes to comedy, but director David Zucker--who also contributed to the writing--takes his fellow writers Jim Abrams and Jerry Zucker and refurbish their "Police Squad" television series into sustained humor. Every bit of it is as ridiculous as it is funny. Take the scene in which Drebin forgets to apply the hand-brake to his car which then starts running off on its own and literally blows up. Such incompetence would have him kicked off from the force, but here, it's treated like it's not out of the ordinary and the show goes on. The pace is relentless, its supposedly serious noir, only being present because stuff happens to go on at night sometimes and its dialogue punchy, unforgiving with a generous quantity of dry but smart PG-13 humor.Yet with comedy putting itself on the pedestal of political responsibility, there is a genuine question of social innuendos and commentary. I am delighted to say there is none. While at first I found the way the movie it's bullying the Queen a supposed joke brought on by the opposing political views of the US and its UK buddy with which it has well-known history, the ending took place at a baseball game--a religion in the US, and it was as cruel to it as it was to the Queen itself. This is Zucker making it clear that the movie will harass anything for fun, including numerous terrorist leaders/organizations--pure comedy.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: With the stupidity of the Police Academy movies and the majority of most 80's comedy, Naked Gun just looks like all of the rest.  But, it is brilliant.  Leslie Neilsen is hilarious in his incompetence as a police officer and his complete oblivious reactions to the chaos he has caused. The subtle jokes in the background are many and the most hilarious of all. You have to pay close attention when you watch this movie, or you will miss a lot of the punchlines.  It is '80s comedy at its best as well as Leslie Neilsen's character he brings to his role.  It is a comedy not to miss.
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!

Review_body: As disappointing as a lot of the late 80's cinema was, Naked Gun, was a godsend.  The jokes are simple but great and Leslie Neilsen is fantastic as Frank Drebin, the forgetful and incompetent member of the L.A. Police Squad. He's trying to track down and reveal a drug-smuggling and assassin ring that is currently trying to assassinate the queen of England on her visit to L.A.  The results are hilarious.  This movie is a must see for comedy and has many small jokes hidden in the background.  And also, it has the funniest opening sequence of any comedy I know.

Review title: One of the Best Spoofs of all time ****1/2 out of *****
Review_body: For those who don't know, The Naked Gun: From the files of Police Squad was a spin off to the very Short Lived series 'Police Squad' which was canned after the 1st episode although 6 were made.LT.Frank Drebin was a tailor made role for Leslie Nielsen, His deadpan delivery has me in stitches every time I watch This movie, Previously Nielsen was a B Movie Actor who appeared in Straight roles, that all changed in Airplane! (1980) as Doctor 'Don't call me Surely' Rumack and has appeared in Spoofs of varying quality ever since, but this along with it's two sequels are his best.LT Drebin and his cop buddies Capt.Ed Hocken (George Kennedy) & Det.Norberg (O.J Simpson) try to foil an assassination of Queen Elizabeth (lookalike Jeannette Charles - Who has played her in various productions) by respected Businessman Vincent Ludwig (The now late Ricardo Montalban who died a couple of days ago)along for the fun ride is also Jane Spencer (Pricilla Presley - While despite not being the best actress in the world is actually surprisingly good) who appears as Ludwig's secretary and later Drebin's Love Interest.The gags are almost non-stop and are incredibly funny even after watching this film as many times as I have, The Zucker Brothers along with Abrahams and Proft are on top form here...It's sooooo Much better than the hit and miss Scary Movie's 3 & 4, Wrongfully accused or Mr Magoo.Leave your brain at the door and enjoy****1/2 out of *****The Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear **** / ***** The Naked Gun 33 1/3: The Final Insult ***1/2 / *****
Movie_name: The Naked Gun - From the Files of Police Squad!
